intro: Comanthera hatschbachii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows from a bulbous stem and has narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to conserve water. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Comanthera hatschbachii is well-suited to harsh environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
